inair.view

Class UIAnimation

  • java.lang.Object
    • inair.view.UIAnimation

  • public final class UIAnimation
extends java.lang.Object

    This class contain all utilities method to create view's animation in inAiR framework


    inAiR animation is base on Android Animator
    Example to use:
    We want to scale 1.2 time by x and 2.0 time by y axis of model and alpha will change to 0.5f 

       // we have view initialize in somewhere
   UIView view = new UIView(context)
   ...

   ...
   // This is a set of animation so we make a set
   AnimatorSet animSet = new AnimatorSet();

   // duration will be 1s
   animSet.setDuration(1000);

   // and interpolator is InOutQuadInterpolator
   animSet.setInterpolator(new InOutQuadInterpolator());

   // transform matrix to scale
   float[] scaleTransform = UIAnimation.identityMatrix();
   Matrix.scaleM(scaleTransform, 0, 1.2f, 2.0f, 0.0f);

   // create scale animation
   Animator scaleAnim = UIAnimation.createTransformAnimation(view, scaleTransform);

   // create alpha animation
   Animator alphaAnim = UIAnimation.createAlphaAnimation(view, alpha);

   // setup animation chain
   animSet.play(scaleAnim).with(alphaAnim);
   ...

   ...
   // run animation
   animSet.start();
   ...

    Note this class is currently under early design and development. The API will likely change in later updates of the compatibility library, requiring changes to the source code of apps when they are compiled against the newer version.

    Copyright (c) 2014 SeeSpace.co. All rights reserved.

      • createAnimationForView

        public static Animator createAnimationForView(UIView view,
                              float[] transform,
                              float alpha)
        Construct an animator for inAiR view with destination state of view as transform and alpha with default duration & delay is 0 and InOutQuadInterpolator

        throw IllegalArgumentException if transform is not an array with 16 float numbers

        Parameters:
        view - view will be apply animation see UIView
        transform - destination transform for view
        alpha - destination alpha for view
        Returns:
        an android animator
